outputs.output_descr: The project is an attempt to make local procurement work for the attainment of local MDG targets and free them from corruption.  It intends to promote transparency and efficiency in the delivery of MDG-related goods and services by establishing and strengthening a participatory procurement system at the local government level particularly in the cities. The 1991 Local Government Code (LGC) of the Philippines has decentralized power and authority to LGUs by providing them significant authority, responsibility, and accountability in planning, implementing, regulating, and monitoring the delivery of basic goods and services.

project_descr: Promoting Procurement Transparency and Efficiency to achieve MDGs
